questions.question_text:
True or false?
• The Ṛig Veda describes the entire geography of India.
• The Viṣhṇu Purāṇa describes the entire Subcontinent.
• In Aśhoka's time, 'Jambudvīpa' included what is today India, parts of Afghanistan, Bangladesh and Pakistan.
• The Mahābhārata lists many regions, including Kashmir, Kutch, and Kerala.
• The term 'Hindustān' first appeared in a Greek inscription more than 2,000 years ago.
• In ancient Persian, the word 'Hindu' refers to the Hindu religion.
• 'Bhārata' is a name given to India by foreign travellers.
hints: Review the sections on ancient names
Check the origins of each term mentioned
Verify geographical descriptions in texts

questions.question_text: If you were born some 2,000 years ago and had the chance to name our country, what name or names might you have chosen, and why? Use your imagination!
hints: Consider geographical features
Think about cultural or spiritual aspects
Look at existing ancient names for inspiration

questions.question_text: Why did people travel to India from various parts of the world in ancient times? What could be their motivations in undertaking such long journeys? (Hint: There could be at least four or five motivations)
hints: Consider trade and commerce
Think about religious or spiritual reasons
Look for educational or scholarly motivations
Consider political or military reasons
